channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.

item.title: More than 10,000 migrants died in 2024 trying to reach Spain by sea, aid group says
item.description: The migration route that connects West African nations with the Spanish Canary Islands remains the deadliest in the world, according to a Spanish aid organization.
item.content:encoded:
The migration route that connects West African nations with the Spanish Canary Islands remains the deadliest in the world, according to a Spanish aid organization.

(Image credit: Desiree Martin)
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: The World's Largest River is Running Low (Encore)
item.description:
The region drained by the Amazon River, including the Amazon Rainforest, is in the second year of a punishing drought. That has lead to the lowest water levels in more than 100 years for the Amazon and its major tributaries. Millions of people and an array of wildlife depend on those quickly disappearing waters. In a story we first brought you in October, we travel to the region to see the effects.

Support our non-profit journalism by joining NPR+
item.content:encoded:
The region drained by the Amazon River, including the Amazon Rainforest, is in the second year of a punishing drought. That has lead to the lowest water levels in more than 100 years for the Amazon and its major tributaries. Millions of people and an array of wildlife depend on those quickly disappearing waters. In a story we first brought you in October, we travel to the region to see the effects.

Support our non-profit journalism by joining NPR+
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Congressional lawmakers almost got a pay bump this year. Then it crashed and burned
item.description: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill haven't had a pay increase since 2009, representing a 31% decline in their salary when adjusted for inflation.
item.content:encoded:
Lawmakers on Capitol Hill haven't had a pay increase since 2009, representing a 31% decline in their salary when adjusted for inflation.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: A health care provider that faced dozens of prisoner lawsuits is filing for bankruptcy
item.description: Wellpath, a health care provider for hospitals, prisons and jails, has been dogged by wrongful death and medical negligence suits. What happens to those cases now that it has filed for bankruptcy?
item.content:encoded:
Wellpath, a health care provider for hospitals, prisons and jails, has been dogged by wrongful death and medical negligence suits. What happens to those cases now that it has filed for bankruptcy?

(Image credit: The Capaci family)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: For homeless seniors, finding stable housing takes a village â€” and a lot of luck
item.description: The number of unhoused seniors is expected to triple by 2030. As rents rise, it becomes tougher to find affordable housing that's accessible for those with medical conditions and disabilities.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

The number of unhoused seniors is expected to triple by 2030. As rents rise, it becomes tougher to find affordable housing that's accessible for those with medical conditions and disabilities.

(Image credit: Aaron Bolton)
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: A wild year in politics, by the numbers
item.description: From the election results to the the charges against President-elect Donald Trump, here are the numbers that defined 2024 in politics.
item.content:encoded:
From the election results to the the charges against President-elect Donald Trump, here are the numbers that defined 2024 in politics.

(Image credit: Richard Pierrin)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: At the end of 1999, many thought Y2K would cause the world to collapse
item.description: At the end of 1999, there was anxiety about a potential computer glitch known as Y2K. Some thought the world would crumble, including some who waited out the apocalypse in an old house in the woods.
item.content:encoded: At the end of 1999, there was anxiety about a potential computer glitch known as Y2K. Some thought the world would crumble, including some who waited out the apocalypse in an old house in the woods.
item.dc:creator: Esther Honig

item.title: Protests in Georgia continue as demonstrators rally in support for joining the EU
item.description: On the eastern edge of the Black Sea, the Georgian president is refusing to step down, as demonstrations have gone on for weeks in support of Georgia joining the European Union.
item.content:encoded: On the eastern edge of the Black Sea, the Georgian president is refusing to step down, as demonstrations have gone on for weeks in support of Georgia joining the European Union.
item.dc:creator: Robin Forestier-Walker

item.title: South Korea's opposition-controlled parliament votes to impeach acting president
item.description: The impeachments of the country's president and then acting-president worsen the nation's political turmoil, deepen its economic uncertainty and hurt its international image.
item.content:encoded:
The impeachments of the country's president and then acting-president worsen the nation's political turmoil, deepen its economic uncertainty and hurt its international image.

(Image credit: Choi Jae-koo/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Finland detains Russia-linked vessel over damaged undersea power cable in Baltic Sea
item.description: Finnish authorities detained a ship linked to neighboring Russia that Finnish customs officials and the European Union's executive commission describe as part of Russia's shadow fleet of fuel tankers.
item.content:encoded:
Finnish authorities detained a ship linked to neighboring Russia that Finnish customs officials and the European Union's executive commission describe as part of Russia's shadow fleet of fuel tankers.

(Image credit: Jussi Nukari/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
